Class ClockDisplay12

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClockDisplay12
  • public class ClockDisplay12
extends java.lang.Object
    The ClockDisplay class implements a digital clock display for a European-style 12 hour clock. The clock shows hours and minutes. The range of the clock is 12:00a.m. (midnight) to 11:59p.m. (one minute before midnight). The clock display receives "ticks" (via the timeTick method) every minute and reacts by incrementing the display. This is done in the usual clock fashion: the hour increments when the minutes roll over to zero.
    Version:
    2022.01.29

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClockDisplay12

        public ClockDisplay12()
        Constructor for ClockDisplay12 objects. This constructor creates a new clock set at 12:00a.m..

      • ClockDisplay12

        public ClockDisplay12​(int hour,
                      int minute,
                      java.lang.String period)
        Constructor for ClockDisplay12 objects. This constructor creates a new clock set at the time specified by the parameters.
        Parameters:
        hour - The hour at which the clock is set to. Valid hours are integers from 1 to 12, otherwise it defaults to 12.
        minute - The minute at which the clock is set to. Valid minutes are integers from 0 to 59, otherwise it defaults to 0.
        period - The period at which the clock is set to. Valid periods are "a.m." or "p.m.," otherwise it defaults to "a.m."

    • Method Detail

      • timeTick

        public void timeTick()
        This method should get called once every minute - it makes the clock display go one minute forward.

      • setTime

        public void setTime​(int hour,
                    int minute,
                    java.lang.String period)
        Set the time of the display to the specified hour, minute, and period
        Parameters:
        hour - The hour at which the clock is set to. Valid hours are integers from 1 to 12, otherwise it doesn't change.
        minute - The minute at which the clock is set to. Valid minutes are integers from 0 to 59, otherwise it doesn't change.
        period - The period at which the clock is set to. Valid periods are "a.m." or "p.m.," otherwise it doesn't change.

      • getTime

        public java.lang.String getTime()
        Return the current time of this display in the format HH:MM.
        Returns:
        Returns a string of the form HH:MMperiod, ex: "12:00a.m."
